card.name: Abbey Gargoyles
card.ability: Flying, protection from red
card.flavor:
"Though Serra has not been seen for twenty years, her Gargoyles still watch over our city and punish the guilty."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

card.name: Abbey Matron
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Abbey Matron gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The Matrons still say Serra is coming back. I bet she never even existed."
—Murat, Death Speaker

card.name: Æther Storm
card.ability:
Creature spells can't be cast.
Pay 4 life: Destroy Æther Storm. It can't be regenerated. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor:
"I do love the rain . . . but this storm feels somehow wrong, Taysir."
—Daria
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This does not stop a creature card from being put directly onto the battlefield by a spell or ability.
8/1/2008 : Affects any spell with the type creature, including those with other types such as artifact or enchantment. This includes older cards with "summon" on their type line.

card.name: Aliban's Tower
card.ability: Target blocking creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Those who hide in hollow towers would do well to remember the rain."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

card.name: Ambush
card.ability: Blocking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Don't these goons have anything better to do?"
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

card.name: Ambush Party
card.ability: First strike, haste
card.flavor:
"Call it a cost of doing business. The best way to protect against thieves is to hire better thieves."
—Eron the Relentless

card.name: Anaba Ancestor
card.ability: {T}: Another target Minotaur creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The Ancestors are the wisdom of the tribe and the soul of the Homelands. I am eternally in their debt."
—Taysir

card.name: Anaba Bodyguard
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"Not someone to pick a fight with, unless you're fond of pain."
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

card.name: Anaba Shaman
card.ability: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"The Shamans? Ha They are mere craven cows not capable of true magic."
—Irini Sengir

card.name: Anaba Spirit Crafter
card.ability: Minotaur creatures get +1/+0.
card.flavor:
"The Spirit Crafters sing of all our people. They sing of those lost, of those found, and of those who are yet to be."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Anaba Spirit Crafter's ability affects all Minotaurs, including Anaba Spirit Crafter itself.

card.name: An-Havva Constable
card.ability: An-Havva Constable's toughness is equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Joskun and the other Constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

card.name: An-Havva Inn
card.ability: You gain X plus 1 life, where X is the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"The Inn was ever a steady source of good cheer and kindness. Greatly do I miss it, now that I am gone."
—Ihsan's Shade

card.name: An-Havva Township
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Folk of good heart will always find a home.

card.name: An-Zerrin Ruins
card.ability:
As An-Zerrin Ruins enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor:
"The An-Zerrins have served me well, ever since I first killed them."
—Baron Sengir

card.name: Apocalypse Chime
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Apocalypse Chime: Destroy all nontoken permanents from the Homelands expansion. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"One day, or another, perhaps I shall ring my pretty chime . . . loudly, so that all may hear."
—Grandmother Sengir

card.name: Autumn Willow
card.ability:
Shroud
{G}: Until end of turn, Autumn Willow can be the target of spells and abilities controlled by target player as though it didn't have shroud.
card.flavor:
"We must shake her limbs and rattle her brains."
—Grandmother Sengir
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell can be countered. Shroud does not work until it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Aysen Abbey
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Serra's gift to her people: a symbol of faith and hope.

card.name: Aysen Bureaucrats
card.ability: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
card.flavor:
"All the tortures of my vault of horrors pale in comparison to dealing with those petty Bureaucrats."
—Baron Sengir
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This checks the power of the creature on activation and on resolution.

card.name: Aysen Crusader
card.ability: Aysen Crusader's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Soldiers and Warriors you control.
card.flavor:
"A renegade rallying the rabble does not a true Crusader make."
—Irini Sengir
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Aysen Crusader's ability counts the number of permanents you control that are Soldiers and/or Warriors. A permanent with both creature types is counted only once.

card.name: Aysen Highway
card.ability: White creatures have plainswalk.
card.flavor:
"Tread the roads of righteousness, Murat, lest you lose your way and be consumed."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

card.name: Baki's Curse
card.ability: Baki's Curse deals 2 damage to each creature for each Aura attached to that creature.
card.flavor:
"Those who fling spells too quickly should have reason to regret it."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

card.name: Baron Sengir
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Baron Sengir this turn dies, put a +2/+2 counter on Baron Sengir.
{T}: Regenerate another target Vampire.
card.flavor: "Beast. Defiler. The source of all my pain."Ihsan's Shade
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The Baron's ability will only regenerate creatures with type "Vampire," regardless of whether the creature has "Vampire" in its name.
9/16/2007 : Although Baron Sengir is now a Vampire, it still can't regenerate itself.

card.name: Beast Walkers
card.ability: {G}: Beast Walkers gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"The Beast Walkers do a great service to Aysen. As humans or as beasts, their heart is yet to Serra true."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Black Carriage
card.ability:
Trample
Black Carriage doesn't untap during your untap step.
Sacrifice a creature: Untap Black Carriage. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.flavor:
"The Baron's drivers are also driven."
—Chandler
card.ruling: 5/1/2008 : The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

card.name: Broken Visage
card.ability: Destroy target nonartifact attacking creature. It can't be regenerated. Put a black Spirit creature token with that creature's power and toughness onto the battlefield. Sacrifice the token at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The token creature enters the battlefield under your control regardless of who controlled the targeted creature.
10/1/2008 : The Spirit token has the power and toughness of the attacking creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Carapace
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"Now, that's a fashion statement."
—Devin, Faerie Noble
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This leaves the battlefield when you activate its activated ability, but the enchanted creature won't be regenerated until the ability resolves. In the intervening time, the creature will no longer have the bonus that this had been giving it. This may cause the creature to be destroyed before the regeneration shield is created.

card.name: Castle Sengir
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Where hope has no champion, evil rules all.

card.name: Cemetery Gate
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from black
card.flavor:
"Just the place for a picnic."
—Murat, Death Speaker

card.name: Chain Stasis
card.ability: You may tap or untap target creature. Then that creature's controller may pay {2}{U}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.
card.flavor:
"Here we go again."
—Kakra, Sea Troll
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The decision to tap or untap is made on resolution of the spell (and of each copy).
10/4/2004 : Paying to make Chain Stasis continue is done as part of the resolution of the spell.
10/4/2004 : The copy is a spell, so it can be targeted by other spells and abilities that target a spell.
10/4/2004 : The player putting the copy spell on the stack controls that spell.
10/4/2004 : The spell copy has all the text and can result in itself being copied.

card.name: Chandler
card.ability: {R}{R}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact creature.
card.flavor:
"Never brag about the latest wonder you've created, students. Chandler might be listening."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

card.name: Clockwork Gnomes
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
card.flavor:
"Until I came to the Floating Isle, I never had to oil the servants."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

card.name: Clockwork Steed
card.ability:
Clockwork Steed enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Steed can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
10/4/2004 : Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
10/1/2008 : When Clockwork Steed's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.
10/1/2008 : If Clockwork Steed has four or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up with a maximum of four such counters on it. If it has four or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.

card.name: Clockwork Swarm
card.ability:
Clockwork Swarm enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Swarm can't be blocked by Walls.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Swarm attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
10/4/2004 : Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
10/4/2004 : If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

card.name: Coral Reef
card.ability:
Coral Reef enters the battlefield with four polyp counters on it.
Sacrifice an Island: Put two polyp counters on Coral Reef.
{U}, Tap an untapped blue creature you control, Remove a polyp counter from Coral Reef: Put a +0/+1 counter on target creature.

card.name: Dark Maze
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"The path of faith is fortunately fraught with failure."
—Irini Sengir

card.name: Daughter of Autumn
card.ability: {W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target white creature this turn is dealt to Daughter of Autumn instead.
card.flavor:
"Those who say that Serra is dead have never met the Autumn Willow's daughters. They are as kind and as generous as Serra would wish us to be."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

card.name: Death Speakers
card.ability: Protection from black
card.flavor:
"Such innocent little birds. They sing a sweet song, sitting on their fragile branch."
—Grandmother Sengir

card.name: Didgeridoo
card.ability: {3}: You may put a Minotaur permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Play the song of he who delivered us. Play the song of Feroz."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Drudge Spell
card.ability:
{B}, Exile two creature cards from your graveyard: Put a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token onto the battlefield. It has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
When Drudge Spell leaves the battlefield, destroy all Skeleton tokens. They can't be regenerated.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This destroys all Skeleton tokens from all sources if it leaves the battlefield. It does not just destroy ones generated by this Drudge Spell or just ones you control.
10/4/2004 : The fact that Skeleton tokens are destroyed is an aspect of the enchantment and not of the tokens. Thus, only Skeleton tokens which are on the battlefield when it leaves the battlefield are destroyed. Ones which are going to appear due to use of the ability but which have not yet appeared are safe.
10/4/2004 : The creatures in the graveyard are exiled during activation as a cost.

card.name: Dry Spell
card.ability: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor:
"My soul thirsts for Serra's salvation, as does my body for life's breath."
—Ihsan's Shade

card.name: Dwarven Pony
card.ability: {1}{R}, {T}: Target Dwarf creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I hear Halina's got a pony that can count to six—and likes to eat meat."
—Chandler

card.name: Dwarven Sea Clan
card.ability: {T}: Choose target attacking or blocking creature whose controller controls an Island. Dwarven Sea Clan deals 2 damage to that creature at end of combat. Activate this ability only before the end of combat step.
card.flavor:
"No dwarf alive can best one of my crew dead."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : You can't target a creature if its controller doesn't control an Island as you are activating the ability, and the ability will be countered if the creature's controller doesn't control an Island as the ability resolves.
8/1/2008 : If control of the targeted creature changes between the activating and resolution of the ability (ie, while it's on the stack), then the player who must control an Island as the ability resolves is the creature's new controller.

card.name: Dwarven Trader
card.flavor:
"They wouldn't sell their own families—at least, not for cheap."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

card.name: Ebony Rhino
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor:
"That Rhino would fetch us a tidy sum, Joven. Perhaps it's time to make it ours."
—Chandler

card.name: Eron the Relentless
card.ability:
Haste
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate Eron the Relentless.
card.flavor:
"Eron would be much less of a hassle if only he were mortal."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

card.name: Evaporate
card.ability: Evaporate deals 1 damage to each white and/or blue creature.
card.flavor:
"The body is a temple with a foundation of sand."
—Autumn Willow
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : A creature which is both blue and white only takes one damage.

card.name: Faerie Noble
card.ability:
Flying
Other Faerie creatures you control get +0/+1.
{T}: Other Faerie creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Faeries talk all in riddles and tricky bits, ‘cept the Nobles. Now, there's some straight talkers."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

card.name: Feast of the Unicorn
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.
card.flavor:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the Baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow

card.name: Feroz's Ban
card.ability: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"Without the protection of Feroz's Ban, I fear the Homelands are lost."
—Daria
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Folk of An-Havva
card.ability: Whenever Folk of An-Havva blocks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"This town's only for good folk. The rest can go to the city."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

card.name: Forget
card.ability: Target player discards two cards, then draws as many cards as he or she discarded this way.

card.name: Funeral March
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor:
"This party is such fun—but it's a shame to mourn just one."
—Irini Sengir

card.name: Ghost Hounds
card.ability:
Vigilance
Whenever Ghost Hounds blocks or becomes blocked by a white creature, Ghost Hounds gains first strike until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Albatross
card.ability:
Flying
When Giant Albatross dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, for each creature that dealt damage to Giant Albatross this turn, destroy that creature unless its controller pays 2 life. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability works no matter how it goes to the graveyard from the battlefield. It seeks out all creatures that damaged it during the turn and causes them to be destroyed.
10/4/2004 : The ability works even if the damage is redirected to the Albatross.
10/4/2004 : The ability is a triggered ability and is only put on the stack once just after this card goes to the graveyard.

card.name: Giant Oyster
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Giant Oyster during your untap step.
{T}: For as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, target tapped creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step, and at the beginning of each of your draw steps, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. When Giant Oyster leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, remove all -1/-1 counters from the creature.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the Oyster untaps during the draw step before its ability to add a -1/-1 counter resolves, the -1/-1 counter effect resolves and adds a -1/-1 counter after the -1/-1 counters are removed due to being untapped.
9/25/2006 : The activated ability can target only a tapped creature.
9/25/2006 : Activating the ability creates a continuous effect that works only as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, a repeating delayed triggered ability that's in effect only as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, and a delayed triggered ability that triggers when Giant Oyster untaps or when it leaves the battlefield.
9/25/2006 : Giant Oyster's ability can be activated during your upkeep, and the creature will get a -1/-1 counter during the draw step that follows it.

card.name: Grandmother Sengir
card.ability: {1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Rarely have power and madness been so delightfully wed as they have in our dear Grandmother."
—Baron Sengir

card.name: Greater Werewolf
card.ability: At end of combat, put a -0/-2 counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Greater Werewolf.
card.flavor:
"The wolf-things are no mere beasts, but the lieutenants of the Baron."
—Taysir

card.name: Hazduhr the Abbot
card.ability: {X}, {T}: The next X damage that would be dealt this turn to target white creature you control is dealt to Hazduhr the Abbot instead.
card.flavor:
"Soon, Serra will return and choose the Abbot's successor, else we are lost."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

card.name: Headstone
card.ability:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"Your headstone is the last page in the book of your life."
—Murat, Death Speaker

card.name: Heart Wolf
card.ability:
First strike
{T}: Target Dwarf creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Heart Wolf. Activate this ability only during combat.

card.name: Hungry Mist
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
card.flavor:
"If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."
—Murat, Death Speaker

card.name: Ihsan's Shade
card.ability: Protection from white
card.flavor:
"Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra Paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

card.name: Irini Sengir
card.ability: Green enchantment spells and white enchantment spells cost {2} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"That cruel being brings shame to all her fellow Dwarves and misery to all the land. She is Sengir's daughter in spirit if not in blood."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

card.name: Ironclaw Curse
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -0/-1.
Enchanted creature can't block creatures with power equal to or greater than the enchanted creature's toughness.

card.name: Jinx
card.ability:
Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"What wizards upset, the land soon rights."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

card.name: Joven
card.ability: {R}{R}{R}, {T}: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
card.flavor:
"Joven, you're almost as good a thief as I. But Eron hates you even more."
—Chandler

card.name: Joven's Ferrets
card.ability:
Whenever Joven's Ferrets attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
At end of combat, tap all creatures that blocked Joven's Ferrets this turn. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : The second ability will trigger only if Joven's Ferrets is still on the battlefield at end of combat. If it's been dealt lethal combat damage and destroyed during that combat (or has left the battlefield during that combat by any other means), its ability won't trigger and the creatures that blocked it won't be affected.
10/1/2008 : If a creature affected by the second ability is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.
10/1/2008 : The second ability doesn't track the creatures' controllers. If an affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Joven's Ferrets will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Joven's Tools
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn except by Walls.
card.flavor:
"If that thief Joven ever shows his head around here again, make sure he leaves without it."
—Eron the Relentless

card.name: Koskun Falls
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Koskun Falls unless you tap an untapped creature you control.
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Koskun Keep
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Treachery and anarchy make poor partners.

card.name: Labyrinth Minotaur
card.ability: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor:
"I doubt any Labyrinth Minotaurs still live—but then again, we Minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : If the creature Labyrinth Minotaur blocked is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.
10/1/2009 : Labyrinth Minotaur doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Leaping Lizard
card.ability: {1}{G}: Leaping Lizard gets -0/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I never question the Autumn Willow about her motives, not even when she turns people into Lizards. It's her way."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

card.name: Leeches
card.ability: Target player loses all poison counters. Leeches deals that much damage to that player.
card.flavor:
"Where our potions and powders fail, perhaps nature will succeed."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

card.name: Mammoth Harness
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses flying.
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, the other creature gains first strike until end of turn.

card.name: Marjhan
card.ability:
Marjhan doesn't untap during your untap step.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Untap Marjhan. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Marjhan can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}{U}: Marjhan gets -1/-0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Marjhan.
card.ruling: 5/1/2008 : The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

card.name: Memory Lapse
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card does not go to the graveyard before being put on the library.
10/4/2004 : This card has a self replacement. This means that it replaces going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If Flashback is applied, however, Flashback will change the destination.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not go to its owner's library.

card.name: Merchant Scroll
card.ability: Search your library for a blue instant card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"There's no trade without trust."
—Eron, the Relentless
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Mesa Falcon
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

card.name: Mystic Decree
card.ability: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.
card.flavor:
"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Narwhal
card.ability: First strike, protection from red
card.flavor:
"Who needs a spear? Ya break off the horn, and ya stab the fish with it. Easy"
—Kakra, Sea Troll

card.name: Orcish Mine
card.ability:
Enchant land
Orcish Mine enters the battlefield with three ore counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, remove an ore counter from Orcish Mine.
When the last ore counter is removed from Orcish Mine, destroy enchanted land and Orcish Mine deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

card.name: Primal Order
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"It's strange, but I can feel it when the land is corrupted. I understand why the Autumn Willow is so protective."
—Daria

card.name: Prophecy
card.ability:
Reveal the top card of target opponent's library. If it's a land, you gain 1 life. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The shuffling and drawing of a card next upkeep happens even if the card is not a land.

card.name: Rashka the Slayer
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Rashka the Slayer blocks one or more black creatures, Rashka gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Rarely be the prey so haughty as to hunt the hunter."
—Baron Sengir
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Gets the bonus only once even if it blocks more than one black creature.
4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Reef Pirates
card.ability: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Corpses for crew don't sit well with me. Zeki and his dead ship had best keep their distance."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

card.name: Renewal
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Renewal, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Retribution
card.ability: Choose two target creatures an opponent controls. That player chooses and sacrifices one of those creatures. Put a -1/-1 counter on the other.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : The player chooses which one to sacrifice as Retribution resolves. If only one of the targets is still legal at that time, then the player must choose that one to sacrifice.

card.name: Reveka, Wizard Savant
card.ability: {T}: Reveka, Wizard Savant deals 2 damage to target creature or player and doesn't untap during your next untap step.
card.flavor:
"It's nice to see a sister Dwarf in a position of such power, but why'd it have to be one of those seafaring muleheads?"
—Halina, Dwarven Trader
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Reveka's effect causes it not to untap during _your_ next untap step. If another player gains control of it, it will untap during that player's next untap step.

card.name: Root Spider
card.ability: Whenever Root Spider blocks, it gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"They're not half as fierce if they don't see you coming."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

card.name: Roots
card.ability:
Enchant creature without flying
When Roots enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
card.flavor:
"That which nourishes can also bind."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

card.name: Roterothopter
card.ability:
Flying
{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
card.flavor:
"The Roterothoper is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

card.name: Rysorian Badger
card.ability: Whenever Rysorian Badger attacks and isn't blocked, you may exile up to two target creature cards from defending player's graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life for each card exiled this way and Rysorian Badger assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Samite Alchemist
card.ability: {W}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control. Tap that creature. It doesn't untap during your next untap step.
card.flavor:
"The wisest of Aysen dwell not in the Abbey, but in the laboratory."
—Taysir

card.name: Sea Sprite
card.ability: Flying, protection from red
card.flavor:
"No one can catch what won't be caught."
—Kakra, Sea Troll

card.name: Sea Troll
card.ability: {U}: Regenerate Sea Troll. Activate this ability only if Sea Troll blocked or was blocked by a blue creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"I've seen those Trolls devour a drowning sailor faster than his lungs could fill with water."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

card.name: Sengir Autocrat
card.ability:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
card.flavor:
"A thankless job, and a death sentence besides."
—Eron the Relentless
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : When it leaves the battlefield, it exiles all Serf tokens on the battlefield and not just the ones it generated or just the ones under your control.

card.name: Sengir Bats
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Bats this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.
card.flavor:
"They are the eyes of the Baron, and they know your fears."
—Ihsan's Shade

card.name: Serra Aviary
card.ability: Creatures with flying get +1/+1.
card.flavor:
"Serra, like Feroz, is long since dead. But remember, Daria: her spirit shall survive so long as the Homelands do."
—Taysir
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Serra Bestiary
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Does prevent the use of activated mana abilities with {Tap} in the cost.

card.name: Serra Inquisitors
card.ability: Whenever Serra Inquisitors blocks or becomes blocked by one or more black creatures, Serra Inquisitors gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Serra Paladin
card.ability:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains vigilance until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Would that I could be a Paladin again, but the dead hold no place among their ranks."
—Ihsan's Shade

card.name: Serrated Arrows
card.ability:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.
{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : The upkeep trigger checks the number of counters at the start of upkeep, and only goes on the stack if there are no arrowhead counters at that time. It will check again on resolution, and will do nothing if you've somehow manage to get a new arrowhead counter on the Arrows.

card.name: Shrink
card.ability: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

card.name: Soraya the Falconer
card.ability:
Bird creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{W}: Target Bird creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"Soraya speaks with the hunters of the air, as do all of her family line."
—Autumn Willow
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Spectral Bears
card.ability: Whenever Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black nontoken permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
card.flavor: "I hear there are Bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."Gulsen, Abbey Matron
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : The checks for black cards is made both at the time you declare attackers and as the ability resolves. If there are any at the time attackers are declared, it won't trigger at all. If there are any at the time it resolves, the ability will do nothing.

card.name: Timmerian Fiends
card.ability:
Remove Timmerian Fiends from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{B}{B}{B}, Sacrifice Timmerian Fiends: The owner of target artifact may ante the top card of his or her library. If that player doesn't, exchange ownership of that artifact and Timmerian Fiends. Put the artifact card into your graveyard and Timmerian Fiends from anywhere into that player's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Both this card and the target must be on the battlefield when announcing the ability. The target must be on the battlefield when the ability resolves or nothing happens.

card.name: Torture
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"It helps you pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir
card.ruling: 5/1/2008 : The -1/-1 counters that are put on the enchanted creature are independent of Torture. If Torture leaves the battlefield or is moved to another creature, the counters will stay put.

card.name: Trade Caravan
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a currency counter on Trade Caravan.
Remove two currency counters from Trade Caravan: Untap target basic land. Activate this ability only during an opponent's upkeep.

card.name: Truce
card.ability: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
card.flavor:
"The people of Aysen feed us, and we don't kill them. That's my kind of truce."
—Eron the Relentless

card.name: Veldrane of Sengir
card.ability: {1}{B}{B}: Veldrane of Sengir gets -3/-0 and gains forestwalk until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Poor, foolish Veldrane. He goes wherever the Baron wills him. One day, he'll go to die."
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

card.name: Wall of Kelp
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}{U}, {T}: Put a 0/1 blue Plant Wall creature token with defender named Kelp onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Ya can eat it or ya can weave it, but ya can't fight in it."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

card.name: Willow Faerie
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"Swift as the wind and harder to catch— that's the Faeries for you."
—Daria

card.name: Willow Priestess
card.ability:
{T}: You may put a Faerie permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
{2}{G}: Target green creature gains protection from black until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Those of faith are those of strength."
—Autumn Willow
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Winter Sky
card.ability: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, Winter Sky deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. If you lose the flip, each player draws a card.

card.name: Wizards' School
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The legacy of Feroz lives on.

card.name: Abbey Matron
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Abbey Matron gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The Matrons are kindly souls, but don't ask one for an ale."
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

card.name: Aliban's Tower
card.ability: Target blocking creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The people of Aysen built their roads with stones from these wonders. Aliban would be pleased with their ingenuity."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

card.name: Ambush Party
card.ability: First strike, haste
card.flavor:
"The roads to Koskun Keep are mostly safe these days. Mostly."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

card.name: Anaba Bodyguard
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"Not all Minotaurs are tribal. Some are freelance."
—Eron the Relentless

card.name: Anaba Shaman
card.ability: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Few master the powers of the earth as well as do the Shamans of the Minotaurs."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

card.name: Aysen Bureaucrats
card.ability: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
card.flavor:
"I would say that our Bureaucrats are no better than vipers—but I shouldn't insult the vipers."
—Murat, Death Speaker
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This checks the power of the creature on activation and on resolution.

card.name: Carapace
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"The tougher to crack, the sweeter the snack."
—Kakra, Sea Troll
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This leaves the battlefield when you activate its activated ability, but the enchanted creature won't be regenerated until the ability resolves. In the intervening time, the creature will no longer have the bonus that this had been giving it. This may cause the creature to be destroyed before the regeneration shield is created.

card.name: Cemetery Gate
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from black
card.flavor:
"It keeps some out, yes. It also keeps others in"
—Grandmother Sengir

card.name: Dark Maze
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"Stray not into the path of darkness, or be lost forever."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

card.name: Dry Spell
card.ability: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow

card.name: Dwarven Trader
card.flavor:
"Their definition of ‘fair profit' is certainly novel."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

card.name: Feast of the Unicorn
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.
card.flavor:
"Some delicacies are not to be savored, save by the callous."
—Baron Sengir

card.name: Folk of An-Havva
card.ability: Whenever Folk of An-Havva blocks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"There are those who accept being told what to do, what to think, and what to say. Then there are the Folk of An-Havva."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

card.name: Giant Albatross
card.ability:
Flying
When Giant Albatross dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, for each creature that dealt damage to Giant Albatross this turn, destroy that creature unless its controller pays 2 life. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability works no matter how it goes to the graveyard from the battlefield. It seeks out all creatures that damaged it during the turn and causes them to be destroyed.
10/4/2004 : The ability works even if the damage is redirected to the Albatross.
10/4/2004 : The ability is a triggered ability and is only put on the stack once just after this card goes to the graveyard.

card.name: Hungry Mist
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
card.flavor:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

card.name: Labyrinth Minotaur
card.ability: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor:
"Legend says they got a treasure cave, but it don't say where to find it."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : If the creature Labyrinth Minotaur blocked is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.
10/1/2009 : Labyrinth Minotaur doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Memory Lapse
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, Wizard Savant
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card does not go to the graveyard before being put on the library.
10/4/2004 : This card has a self replacement. This means that it replaces going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If Flashback is applied, however, Flashback will change the destination.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not go to its owner's library.

card.name: Mesa Falcon
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Pretty Falcon, friend to Soraya. Will you send her my greetings?"
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

card.name: Reef Pirates
card.ability: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Zeki sails with a dead crew not out of villainy, but pragmatism."
—Baron Sengir

card.name: Samite Alchemist
card.ability: {W}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control. Tap that creature. It doesn't untap during your next untap step.
card.flavor:
"Powders and potions are nothing compared to faith."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

card.name: Sengir Bats
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Bats this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.
card.flavor:
"In the face of every one I see the Baron."
—Daria

card.name: Shrink
card.ability: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The smallest beast can yet have the greatest heart."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

card.name: Torture
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"Oh, they scream, right enough, and plead, too—but the Baron keeps no mercy in his vault of horrors."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate
card.ruling: 5/1/2008 : The -1/-1 counters that are put on the enchanted creature are independent of Torture. If Torture leaves the battlefield or is moved to another creature, the counters will stay put.

card.name: Trade Caravan
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a currency counter on Trade Caravan.
Remove two currency counters from Trade Caravan: Untap target basic land. Activate this ability only during an opponent's upkeep.

card.name: Willow Faerie
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"The Autumn Willow cannot be everywhere at once—that's what her grandchildren are for."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron
